title: PassPredictR: Contextualizing NFL Throwing Decisions Through Modeling Receiver Choice

yaml.title: PassPredictR: Contextualizing NFL Throwing Decisions Through Modeling Receiver Choice

markdown.headingText: Motivating Example - PJ Walker to DJ Moore
markdown.markdown:
::: {style="text-align: center;"} ::: ## Motivating Questions ::: fragment - What would other quarterbacks do in this situation? ::: ::: fragment - Which quarterbacks deviate from the expected option the most? - Do some quarterbacks find success in this deviation? - Should some quarterbacks throw more typical passes? ::: ::: fragment - Look to build a ranking model to determine the most likely throw target ::: ## Data Overview {.smaller} ::::::::: columns ::::::: {.column width="50%"} - **2024 NFL Big Data Bowl – 2022 Season Weeks 1–9** ::: fragment - **Game and Play Data** – Teams, Score, Play Description, Game Context, Play Result, Changes in Win Probability ::: ::: fragment - **Player Play Data** – Statistics for each player for a play - Route ran by player, Whether the player made a tackle or interception ::: ::: fragment - **Tracking Data** - Locations of players and the football at each frame of a play ::: ::: fragment - Exclusively looking at throwing plays with an obvious target ::: ::::::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: ::::::::: ## Current Spacing Tells an Incomplete Story ::: {style="text-align: center;"} ::: ## Speed and Orientation as a Proxy for Future Separation ::::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"}
::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: ::::: ## Deriving QB Line of Sight Prior to Throw ## Methodology ::: fragment - Building a ranking algorithm(i.e. [XGBoost](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/xgboost/xgboost.pdf)) using hand-crafted features to rank the likeliest recipient at a frame - 59.9 $\pm$ 0.5% top-1 accuracy - Using a random hyperparameter search and 5-fold cross validation, with folds on matches - Performs significantly stronger than naive random guess(20%) and choosing the player who is farthest from their closest defender(31%) ::: ::: fragment - Applying model to contextualize individual QB decisions by comparing them to model-predicted choices ::: ## Feature Set {.smaller} | Feature Category | Features | |------------------------------------|------------------------------------| | **Recipient Features** | \- *Distance (x, y, magnitude)\**
- *Speed Differences (x, y, magnitude)\**
- *Orientation Differences\**
- *Speed Vector Distance\**
- Receiver Position
- First Down Indicator
- Number of Defenders in Route-Runner's "Next 5 Yards"
- Angle between QB Orientation and Receiver 5 Frames Prior
| | **Quarterback Features** | \- Distance from Receiver
- Movement Vector
- Under Pressure Indicator | | **Game Context** | \- Quarter, Time Remaining
- Down and Distance, Score Differential |

*\*Feature taken relative to the top-3 closest defenders* ## For P.J. Walker, The Expected Play is the Safe Play ::::: columns ::: {.column width="66%"} ::: ::: {.column width="34%"}

::: ::::: ## Checking with the Eye Test ::::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"}
::: ::: {.column width="50%"}
::: ::::: ## Potential Optimization Opportunities with More Conventional Passes ::: {style="text-align: center;"} ::: ## Discussion {.small} ::: fragment - Able to model the likely target using an XGBoost Ranking Model with strong predictive power - Improvements from incorporating newer factors like receiver skill and pre-snap factors ::: ::: fragment - Reliance on proxies which could add bias to results - Smaller dataset, only about 200 throws per quarterback - Would like to model quarterback development throughout their career ::: ## Further Information - Acknowledgements: Dr. Karim Kassam, Quang Nguyen, Dr. Ron Yurko, CMU Statistics - Code: - Contact Us: - Lou Zhou: [lou-zhou.github.io](https://lou-zhou.github.io) - Zachary Pipping: [zachbtw.github.io](zachbtw.github.io) ## Appendix A - Projecting Future Locations With a Point Estimate ::: {style="text-align: center;"} ::: ## Appendix B - Variable Importance ::: {style="text-align: center; width: 100%;"} ::: ## Appendix C - Example for Vision Features ::: {style="text-align: center;"} ::: ## Appendix D - Optimal QB Vision Derivation ::: {style="text-align: center;"} ::: ## Appendix E - Head Tracking Proof of Concept ::: {style="text-align: center;"} :::
